oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Colonel Frank W. McNairy
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Lt. Colonel Frank N. McNairy in Confederate uniform. His right hand rests on the hilt of a sword; he holds a slouch hat in the other hand on his left hip. Written beneath the image is "Killed in the second battle of Fort Donelson."

McNairy was killed in the "Second Battle of Fort Donelson," the February 3, 1863, event when 2500 Confederate troops under Maj. Gen. Joseph Wheeler attacked a small garrison (800 men) at Dover, Tenn., under Col. A.C. Harding.; The Confederate failure to capture the garrison left the Federals in control of Middle Tennessee. Nathan Bedford Forrest denounced Wheeler after this battle and refused to serve under him again.
